moves.1. e4: This was one of my greatest games, enjoy!
moves.1... d5: Scandinavian, better than Sicilian or 1.e5 for me.
moves.2... f6 3. exf6: Now i thought about gxf6 or nxf6, i chose the knight.
moves.3... Nxf6 4. Qf3: kinda purposeless, and a little bit early.
moves.4... e5: Taking full control of the center.
moves.5... c6 6. Ba4 Bg4: Striking at the queen and developing with tempo.
moves.7. Qb3: aiming b7 but that is no problem
moves.7... Na6: If qxb7 then nc5 and after that rb8, it is worth for that pawn.
moves.8. Qg3: so my opponent makes a strange move again with no purpose.
moves.9. h3: If he attacks my bishop then i attack his :).
moves.10... Nxa4 11. Qf3: he really likes to move his queen around.
moves.11... e4: And the queen is harassed yet again.
moves.12... O-O: Castle, with thoughts of moving the knight on f6.
moves.13. b3: Attacking my knight, not that would be a problem in the near future, I really wanted to move that knight.
moves.13... Nc5 14. Ba3: Again putting pressure on the knight.
moves.15... Na6: That is a bit awkward but i want to maintain the pressure on g4.
moves.16... Bxb4 17. Bxb4 Nxb4 18. g5: He saw the threat on g4 and attacks my knight.
moves.19... h6 20. Rh4: He attacks my knight twice but f2 is falling now.
moves.20... Nxf2: With a knight like that white is in serious trouble.
moves.21... Qe7: Aiming the rook and protecting the knight.
moves.22... Qxh4: Rook for free and a check mate coming, not so free but he didn't captured my knight because he was concerned about his king.
moves.25. cxd3 Nxd3#:
I really liked this game, some pieces didn't even move, my rook on a8 and his knight and rook on g1 and a1.
             I found this ending very nice, besides of my weak playing, fortunately my opponent played weaker.
             This was one of my few wins here at G.K. And I posted this only for this checkmate, with his helpless queen on the table and the knight sack.
             Hope you enjoyed the game!
